result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to contact Probation Office in Portage, WI by 4pm today

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent 
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by Agent
Credit  =  1 day (if revoked)
All costs to be paid through Probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas David Kaczmarek

records.addlTxt:
11:39 AM Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Nicholas David Kaczmarek.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states that the matter is resolved.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement. Atty Watts agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Watts makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Credit = 1 day (if revoked)
Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek not in court.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Nicholas David Kaczmarek. 
Atty Watts has an authorization on file; waiting on information from his PO that the DA requested.  Atty Watts requests another status.  

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek not in court.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Nicholas David Kaczmarek. 
Atty Watts states that there is an authorization.  Atty Watts states that the defendant has completed treatment now; requests one more status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:10 PM Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek not in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Nicholas David Kaczmarek. 
Atty watts states that the defendant is in treatment.

BY THE COURT:  set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:27 AM Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video means for Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Watts received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Watts enters Not Guilty plea.    BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Demand for Discovery & Inspection and Motion for Time to File Additional Pretrial Motions

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:51 PM Defendant Nicholas David Kaczmarek appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant doesn't have a phone.    Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and asks for one to be appointed.  

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
